com.ojcoleman.europa.monitor

Class SelectiveMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ComponentBase
          • com.ojcoleman.europa.core.Monitor
            • com.ojcoleman.europa.monitor.FileOrCLIMonitor
              • com.ojcoleman.europa.monitor.SelectiveMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer, Stringable, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DebugMonitor

    public abstract class SelectiveMonitor
extends FileOrCLIMonitor
    Base class for a Monitor that prints info for the user-specified classes and event names to the standard output stream (console) and/or a file.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

      • listenTo

           optional=true)

      • logEvents

        @Parameter(description="The names of events to print info for. This only works if the event object is an enum. Leave blank to listen to all events. This is case-insensitive.",
           defaultValue="[]")
protected java.lang.String[] logEvents

      • iterationPeriod

        @Parameter(description="Only log events when the current iteration/generation is a factor of the iterationPeriod.",
           defaultValue="1",
           minimumValue="1")
protected int iterationPeriod

    • Method Detail

      • eventOccurred

        public void eventOccurred(Observable observed,
                 java.lang.Object event,
                 java.lang.Object state)
        Description copied from interface: Observer
        Called when the subject being observed triggers an event (generally when it has changed state in a significant way).
        Parameters:
        observed - The subject (the object being observed).
        event - An object indicating the type of change or event, this is usually an Enum defined by the Subject. If null is given then the Observer(s) will be passed Observable.Event.Unspecified.
        state - An arbitrary object typically describing the current state of the Observable or information about the event.

      • log

        protected abstract void log(Observable observed,
       java.lang.Object event,
       java.lang.Object state)
        Called when an event has been selected to be logged.
        Parameters:
        observed - The subject (the object being observed).
        event - An object indicating the type of change or event, this is usually an Enum defined by the Subject. If null is given then the Observer(s) will be passed Observable.Event.Unspecified.
        state - An arbitrary object typically describing the current state of the Observable or information about the event.
